 We are pleased to invite you to participate in an expert workshop on Environmental Geochemical Modeling, designed for Master’s, PhD students and everybody interested in deepening their understanding of hydrogeochemical processes through hands-on training with Geochemical Workbench (GWB). 

 O wydarzeniu 

📅 Workshop Duration: Two weeks (24/3–3/04)
 📍 Location: WGGiOŚ AGH
 👨‍🏫 Instructor: 
Prof. Michael Kersten
, University of Mainz, Germany

This intensive course will provide step-by-step guidance on setting up and running geochemical models, simulating major hydrogeochemical processes, and interpreting results through graphical outputs. Participants will gain practical experience with:
 ✅ GWB Software: Ion balance, solubility, adsorption, redox reactions, and optimization of laboratory data.
 ✅ Case Studies: Modeling of contaminated aquifers, geothermal systems, and natural water evolution.

This workshop is highly recommended for students and researchers working with groundwater chemistry, water resources, experimental mineralogy and/or environmental geochemistry. Basic knowledge of hydrogeology and water chemistry is expected.

Seats are limited! Please confirm your participation by 20/3/2025.
 For registration or further inquiries, feel free to contact 
Bartosz Puzio
.
